pullRequest.body:
Prove regularity of `RieszContent`, define the Riesz measure `μ Λ` and prove basic properties.

Motivation: these definitions and lemmas will be used to prove the Riesz-Markov-Kakutani theorem, characterizing `μ Λ`.

In this PR, it is assumed to be NNReal-linear. In this way, the proof of the RMK theorem will be twice as long as a proof for `Real`-linear `Λ` because one cannot define `-f`. #12290 proves the RMK theorem for real linear `Λ`, using the Riesz measure defined in this PR through `toNNRealLinear`.

Most probably the naming `Λ_mono` is not good, but I don't know which is the right one.

### PR summary [5e4f8e4c01](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20040/commits/5e4f8e4c01a8f82088a1828de86bae1c049ef51c)

#### Import changes for modified files

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.RieszMarkovKakutani | 1550 | 1558 | +8 (+0.52%) |
| Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousMap.CompactlySupported | 1468 | 1469 | +1 (+0.07%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousMap.CompactlySupported`|1|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.RieszMarkovKakutani`|8|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CompactlySupportedContinuousMap.monotone_of_nnreal`
`+ contentRegular_rieszContent`
`+ exist_add_eq`
`+ le_rieszMeasure_of_isCompact_tsupport_subset`
`+ le_rieszMeasure_of_tsupport_subset`
`+ rieszContent_ne_top`
`+ rieszMeasure`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Great to see this moving forward! Could you please address the comments I made on #12290 ? Thanks!
Thanks for your reviews! sure, I will do it.

```suggestion
    (h : tsupport f ⊆ K) : .ofNNReal (Λ f) ≤ rieszMeasure Λ K := by
```

What about
```suggestion
lemma CompactlySupportedContinuousMap.monotone_of_nnreal : Monotone Λ := by
```
`LE` is not defined for `C_c(X, NNReal)`. for the moment I revert this.
Can you leave a comment about why you can't spell that lemma with `Monotone`?
done

```suggestion
lemma rieszContent_ne_top {K : Compacts X} : rieszContent Λ K ≠ ⊤ := by
```

```suggestion
  simp only [rieszContent, le_antisymm_iff, le_iInf_iff, ENNReal.coe_le_coe]
  constructor
```
will let you golf things below

```suggestion
      have : Λ f * α = Λ (α.toNNReal • f) := by
```
Why is this about `V : Opens X` rather than `V : Set X` + `IsOpen V`?
I did so because in #12290 I defined `V` which takes value in `Opens`. Should I change?
Yeah, more syntactically general lemmas are better, unless you think this lemma will only ever be used for `V : Opens X`, but I don't really see why that would be the case myself
I see. done and changed the names of the lemmas

```suggestion
      set K' := f ⁻¹' Ici α⁻¹.toNNReal with hK'
```
Same thing here for `K`

```suggestion
lemma CompactlySupportedContinuousMap.monotone_of_nnreal {f₁ f₂ : C_c(X, ℝ≥0)} (h : f₁.1 ≤ f₂.1) :
```
Any reason you're squeezing this simp? It's already terminal
no particular reason (here I have to first `rw`). Why should one not squeeze?
[This is explained in the style guide](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style#squeezing-simp-calls)

Can you make the docstring not rely on context that the reader can only access by scrolling through the file?

Currently if I hover over `rieszMeasure` and see
```
`rieszContent` is promoted to a measure.
```
I still don't know what `rieszMeasure` is
I explained what `rieszContent` is, is this what you mean?

```suggestion
lemma le_rieszMeasure_of_isCompact_tsupport_subset {f : C_c(X, ℝ≥0)} (hf : ∀ x, f x ≤ 1)
```

```suggestion
lemma exist_add_eq {f₁ f₂ : C_c(α, ℝ≥0)} (h : f₁.1 ≤ f₂.1)  : ∃ (g : C_c(α, ℝ≥0)), f₁ + g = f₂ := by
```

pullRequest.title: feat(MeasureTheory/Integral/RieszMarkovKakutani) prove that the Riesz content is regular and define the Riesz measure
